name: 柯萊恩
objective: In this course we will examine literature’s three major genres: fiction, poetry and drama through short selections of some of the most important literary works of the 18th, 19th, 20th and 21st centuries.  Emphasis will be on developing a working terminology by which to discuss and write about literary works.  Thus we will learn how to employ terms such as character, setting, mood, style, plot and conflict.  In so doing we will learn to appreciate the spiritual, aesthetic, political and philosophical usages, demands and delights of literature.
